meanings.definition: The breakdown of organic substances by living organisms.
meanings.sent1: Biodegradation helps nature recycle waste materials.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study biodegradation to understand how nature cleans up pollutants.
meanings.sent3: The party theme was 'biodegradation bash' where everything had to decompose naturally.
meanings.sent4: In the forest, biodegradation works like a team of tiny cleaners breaking down fallen leaves.
meanings.sent5: The smell of biodegradation in the compost pile was earthy and fresh.

meanings.definition: The process by which materials are broken down into simpler substances by biological organisms.
meanings.sent1: Biodegradation is essential for turning food scraps into nutrient-rich soil.
meanings.sent2: The biodegradation of plastic bottles can take hundreds of years in landfills.
meanings.sent3: The cartoon character joked, 'I wish my homework could undergo biodegradation and disappear!'
meanings.sent4: Time is the master of biodegradation, slowly transforming all things back to basics.
meanings.sent5: The power of biodegradation is like a silent force of nature, quietly breaking down what we leave behind.
